name: Raspberries
statement: You are given an array of integers $$$a_1, a_2, \ldots, a_n$$$ and a number $$$k$$$ ($$$2 \leq k \leq 5$$$). In one operation, you can do the following: Choose an index $$$1 \leq i \leq n$$$, Set $$$a_i = a_i + 1$$$. Find the minimum number of operations needed to make the product of all the numbers in the array $$$a_1 \cdot a_2 \cdot \ldots \cdot a_n$$$ divisible by $$$k$$$.
inputFormat: Each test consists of multiple test cases. The first line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \leq t \leq 10^4$$$) — the number of test cases. Then follows the description of the test cases. The first line of each test case contains two integers $$$n$$$ and $$$k$$$ ($$$2 \leq n \leq 10^5$$$, $$$2 \leq k \leq 5$$$) — the size of the array $$$a$$$ and the number $$$k$$$. The second line of each test case contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \ldots, a_n$$$ ($$$1 \leq a_i \leq 10$$$). It is guaranteed that the sum of $$$n$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$2 \cdot 10^5$$$.
outputFormat: For each test case, output the minimum number of operations needed to make the product of all the numbers in the array divisible by $$$k$$$.
